Generation V.Black: It makes a nest out of bones it finds. It grabs weakened prey in its talons and hauls it to its nest of bones.
Generation V.White: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.
Generation V.Black 2: They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest with ease.
Generation V.White 2: They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest with ease.

Generation VI.X: They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest with ease.
Generation VI.Y: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: They fly in circles around the sky. When they spot prey, they attack and carry it back to their nest with ease.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.

Generation VII.Sun: They adorn themselves beautifully with bones. This is supposedly an effort to attract males, but no male Mandibuzz have ever been found.
Generation VII.Moon: It circles in the sky, keeping a keen eye out for Pokémon in a weakened state. Its choicest food is Cubone.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It skillfully arranges the bones of its prey to construct its nest. Most of the bones are Cubone.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It's always searching for food for Vullaby. When it finds a weak Pokémon, Mandibuzz swoops it right off to its nest.

Generation VIII.Sword: Although it's a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will take lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them till they're ready to leave the nest.
Generation VIII.Shield: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It's always searching for food for Vullaby. When it finds a weak Pokémon, Mandibuzz swoops it right off to its nest.
Generation IX.Violet: Watching from the sky, they attack weakened prey on the ground. They have a habit of decorating themselves with bones.

Generation VIII.Shield: Dusty Bowl , Lake of Outrage Rolling Fields , East Lake Axewell , West Lake Axewell , Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness , Giant's Mirror ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield Expansion Pass: Challenge Road ( Wanderer ) Loop Lagoon , Dusty Bowl ( Max Raid Battle )
